workflow.name: Multi-source RAG system with GPT-4 Turbo, news & academic papers integration
workflow.description:
# Multi-Source RAG System with GPT-4 Turbo, News & Academic Papers Integration

This workflow provides an enterprise-grade RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) system that intelligently searches multiple sources and generates AI-powered responses using GPT-4 Turbo.

## How it works

This workflow provides an enterprise-grade RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) system that intelligently searches multiple sources and generates AI-powered responses using GPT-4 Turbo.

## Key Steps

1. **Form Input** - Collects user queries with customizable search scope, response style, and language preferences
2. **Intelligent Search** - Routes queries to appropriate sources (web, academic papers, news, internal documents)
3. **Data Aggregation** - Unifies and processes information from multiple sources with quality scoring
4. **AI Processing** - Uses GPT-4 Turbo to generate context-aware, source-grounded responses
5. **Response Enhancement** - Formats outputs in various styles (comprehensive, concise, technical, etc.)
6. **Multi-Channel Delivery** - Delivers results via webhook, email, Slack, and optional PDF generation

## Data Sources & AI Models

### Search Sources
- **Web Search**: Google, Bing, DuckDuckGo integration
- **Academic Papers**: arXiv, PubMed, Google Scholar
- **News Articles**: News API, RSS feeds, real-time news
- **Technical Documentation**: GitHub, Stack Overflow, documentation sites
- **Internal Knowledge**: Google Drive, Confluence, Notion integration

### AI Models
- **GPT-4 Turbo**: Primary language model for response generation
- **Embedding Models**: For semantic search and similarity matching
- **Custom Prompts**: Specialized prompts for different response styles

## Set up steps

**Setup time: 15-20 minutes**

1. **Configure API credentials** - Set up OpenAI API, ScrapeGraphAI, Google Drive, and other service credentials
2. **Set up search sources** - Configure academic databases, news APIs, and internal knowledge sources
3. **Connect analytics** - Link Google Sheets for usage tracking and performance monitoring
4. **Configure notifications** - Set up Slack channels and email templates for automated alerts
5. **Test the workflow** - Run sample queries to verify all components are working correctly

**Keep detailed configuration notes in sticky notes inside your workflow**

parameters.formDescription: Advanced RAG system for intelligent research and content generation

parameters.content:
# Advanced RAG Form üöÄ

**Intelligent Input System:**
- Advanced query processing
- Search scope selection
- Response style customization
- Multi-language support
- Diverse output formats

**Main Fields:**
- **Query**: User input (textarea)
- **Search Scope**: Web/Academic/News/Technical/Internal
- **Response Style**: Comprehensive/Concise/Technical/Executive
- **Language**: IT/EN/ES/FR/DE
- **Output Format**: MD/HTML/PDF/JSON/PPT
- **Email**: For notifications
- **Priority**: Queue management

**Features:**
‚úÖ Real-time input validation
‚úÖ Webhook response for feedback
‚úÖ Multi-format support
‚úÖ Priority queue management

# üîç Query Preprocessor

**Purpose:** Validates and preprocesses user input for optimal search performance.

**Key Functions:**
- Input validation (minimum 3 characters)
- Query cleaning and normalization
- Keyword extraction for search optimization
- Search strategy determination based on scope
- Session ID generation for tracking

**Output:** Structured query object with metadata for downstream processing.

# üîÑ Search Router

**Purpose:** Routes queries to appropriate search sources based on scope selection.

**Routing Logic:**
- **Web General**: Google, Bing, DuckDuckGo
- **Academic Papers**: Scholar, arXiv, PubMed
- **News Articles**: News API, RSS feeds
- **Technical Docs**: GitHub, Stack Overflow
- **Company Internal**: Drive, Confluence, Notion
- **Multi Source**: Combined approach

**Benefits:** Optimized search results for specific use cases.

# üß† Context Builder

**Purpose:** Prepares comprehensive context for GPT-4 Turbo processing.

**Context Elements:**
- Query information and metadata
- Retrieved sources with relevance scores
- Source quality indicators
- Processing metadata and session tracking

**AI Instructions:**
- Language-specific prompts
- Response style customization
- Source citation requirements
- Quality and accuracy guidelines

**Output:** Structured messages for LLM processing.

# ü§ñ Advanced LLM Processor

**Model:** GPT-4 Turbo (gpt-4-turbo-preview)

**Configuration:**
- Max Tokens: 2048
- Temperature: 0.3 (balanced creativity/accuracy)
- Top P: 0.9

**Processing:**
- Receives structured context from Context Builder
- Generates source-grounded responses
- Maintains citation integrity
- Follows style and language preferences

**Output:** Raw AI-generated response with usage statistics.

# ‚ú® Response Enhancer

**Purpose:** Formats and enhances AI responses for multiple output formats.

**Format Options:**
- **Markdown**: Default structured format
- **HTML**: Web-ready with styling
- **JSON**: API-friendly structured data
- **PDF**: Document generation (optional)

**Enhancements:**
- Quality indicators and metrics
- Source breakdown and citations
- Usage statistics and performance data
- Session tracking and metadata

**Output:** Formatted response ready for delivery.

# üì§ Webhook Response

**Purpose:** Delivers formatted responses back to the user interface.

**Response Types:**
- Complete response data
- Formatted output (MD/HTML/JSON)
- Metadata and quality metrics
- Session information

**Integration:**
- Webhook endpoint for real-time responses
- Email notifications (optional)
- Slack integration (optional)
- Analytics tracking

**Benefits:** Immediate feedback and comprehensive data delivery.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
